setup2faMain.title: Setup Two-factor Authentication
setup2faMain.scanQrInstructions: Open the Google Authenticator app and scan this QR code.
setup2faMain.manualSetupPrompt: Unable to scan? You can use the
setup2faMain.manualSetupSuffix: to manually configure your authenticator app.
setup2faMain.downloadAppInfo: Don’t have the app? Google Authenticator is a free 2FA app. Download it on your mobile device by searching for “Google Authenticator” on the Play Store or Apple Store.

setup2faBackup.title: Setup Two-factor Authentication
setup2faBackup.backupCodesInfo: With 2FA enabled for your account, you can use the recovery codes as a second factor to authenticate in case you lose your device. We recommend keeping them in a secure place.
setup2faBackup.keepSafeTitle: Keep your recovery codes in a safe spot
setup2faBackup.keepSafeInfo: If you lose your device and can’t find your recovery codes, you will lose access to your account.

setup2faSuccess.title: Setup Two-factor Authentication
setup2faSuccess.successTitle: Two-factor authentication (2FA) is now enabled for your account!
setup2faSuccess.shortInfo: From now on, you’ll use Google Authenticator to sign in.
setup2faSuccess.longInfo: You have successfully enabled two-factor app authentication on your account. 2FA will be required even when signing in via Google or any third-party login method. From now on, whenever you sign in to your account, you’ll need to enter both your password and an authentication code.

aria.doneButton: Finish two-factor authentication setup and return to homepage

twoFactor.title: Two-factor authentication
twoFactor.description: Two-factor authentication is an enhanced security measure. Once enabled, you’ll be required to give two types of identification when you log into this website. Google Authenticator is supported.
twoFactor.ariaToggle: Enable or disable Google Authenticator two-factor authentication
